sect2.title: Installation of Zlib
sect2.para: Zlib has a potential buffer overflow in its gzprintf() function, that, though difficult to take advantage of, should be taken care of. Do so by applying this patch:
The -fPIC flag helps to assure quality in the dynamic zlib library.

screen.userinput: make install && make clean && ./configure --prefix=/usr && make && make install

sect2.para: The shared zlib library should be installed in the /lib directory. That way, in the event that you must boot without the /usr directory, vital system programs will still have access to the library:
